Culture test:
Based on the above information on Culture test results of the donor, please extract information on sub-tissues and microorganisms found in them and present the result in the JSON format explained above.

CRITICAL REMINDERS:
- Extract ONLY tissue culture results (recovery, pre-processing, post-processing, processing filters)
- DO NOT extract blood, sputum, urine, stool, or bronchial culture results
- Include the FULL, EXACT sub-tissue name as it appears in the document
- Extract ALL microorganisms listed for each sub-tissue, maintaining their exact names
- If a culture is negative or shows no growth, return an empty list [] for that sub-tissue
- Handle tissue name variations consistently (e.g., 'tib/fib' variations)
- Return ONLY valid JSON format - no additional text, explanations, or markdown formatting
- Ensure all sub-tissues from the document are included in your response
Serology test:
Based on the above information, please extract the names of the tests performed and their corresponding results in the JSON format explained above.

CRITICAL REMINDERS:
- Extract ONLY when both the test name AND its corresponding result are present together in the given donor information
- Do NOT alter, normalize, or standardize test names - maintain them exactly as written
- Do NOT alter, normalize, or standardize results - maintain them exactly as written
- Extract EVERY occurrence of each test wherever it appears in the document
- If a test appears multiple times with different results, include all instances
- If a test name appears but no result is visible, do NOT include that test
- Pay attention to combined test panels and extract them as single entries
- Return ONLY valid JSON format - no additional text, explanations, or markdown formatting
- Ensure all serology tests from the document are included in your response
